column1: length ball on leg stump, easily tapped to midwicket to get off the mark
good length, well outside off and he lets it go through
good length and gets it closer to the stumps, prompting Munro to go for the cut. Only under-edges it, and the ball rolls back to the bowler's right
slower ball, 110 kph, good length and on the stumps. Munro waits for it and taps it into the leg side for a quick single
strays on the pads again, and Guptill is able to put it away easily to midwicket
fuller outside off, driven firmly to mid-off. He calls for the run and they make it safely
lovely shot very full and on the stumps, he straight drives it past the bowler and into the boundary. Didn't have an exaggerated follow through, but didn't need one, the timing was so good
fullish on the pads and flicked to deep midwicket
a bit short and those powerful forearms of Munro come into play. A short-arm jab-pull from middle stump, sends it over the in-field and into the midwicket fence
crashed Pradeep adjusts his line to outside off, but still stays on the fuller side. No difference though, as Munro crashes it powerfully through cover for another boundary

pulls his length back but stays outside off and Munro punches with authority, but cover dives and prevents it from going past the in-field. This outfield is quick, so once the ball is through, there is little chance of stopping it
clipped wide of mid-on from the pads, but another diving save means the batsmen are kept to one run
good length on off stump, defended towards point
good length on the stumps, and Guptill pats it back from the crease to the bowler's left
strays on the pads again - he's been doing that a fair bit already, has Malinga - and Guptill is happy to pick him off to deep square leg
back of a length on the stumps, defended towards silly point with an open face. No one close in so they take the quick single
on the pads again, and Guptill turns this finer. Short fine leg is there however, and he moves to his left to field
slower ball again, just 111.2 clicks, full on off stump. He was a little early into the drive and it goes to mid-off from the toe-end
too straight and flicked nicely, but Thisara at mid-on puts in a good fielding effort again, tumbling to his right
length ball, angling into the left-hander from around the wicket, tucked to square leg
good length ball, on the stumps, tucked to deep square leg
good length on the stumps, he moves a bit across to clip it towards a wide long-on

rapped on the pads and a big appeal But they're not going for the review. Good piece of bowling, length ball jagging back in, defeats Guptill's intended airy flick. But perhaps that was going down leg? And great decision by Malinga to not review, because replays show that was missing leg. It certainly appeared a close shout at first sight
fuller outside off, driven past cover
first yorker from Malinga. Full and swinging in, defended off his toes
length ball on the stumps, another slower one - he's almost bowling 3-4 of those per over - and Munro waits for it and guides it to midwicket
back of a length outside off, that was at 135.7 kph. Guptill stands tall and punches, but can't get past cover
back of a length on off stump again, defended towards cover-point
back of a length again, but loses his line and Guptill flicks it off his hips. Seekuge Prasanna runs across from deep square leg to put in a full-length dive, but it's to no avail

got 'im huge wicket, Guptill was looking solid and was coming off a century in the last match. Good length ball that moved away after pitching. Got his line perfect though, in the channel outside off. Guptill was tempted into driving on the up, but the movement and slightly higher bounce meant it caught a healthy edge and was pouched by the keeper
too short, angling into the left-hander and he isn't going to be cowed down by the lost wicket. Pulls it powerfully to deep midwicket, over the in-field
full ball outside off, Williamson comes on the front foot to defend
back of a length outside off, Williamson stands tall and punches. Gunathilaka at point dives but mis-fields, allowing them to pinch a single
too full on off and he brings out the straight drive again, but a diving stop at mid-on prevents the ball from racing away to the boundary
good length outside off, Williamson punches it to the bowler's left
full ball on off stump, driven back, but the bowler fields

beauty the speed gun shows that as 138 clicks, but it was almost like a fast spinner. Off-cutter, pitched on the left-hander's leg stump and broke away to snake past the outside edge, with Munro left feeling for it
back of a length on off, steered to point
slower ball now, full and on middle stump, Munro is too early into the drive. Mis-times it along the ground to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, he stays inside the line and tucks it to fine leg
back of a length and on the stumps, again some movement away, but it's too short to trouble Williamson, who defends to point from his crease
fuller ball on off, steered to point's right. They think about the single but decide against it
back of a length outside off, he goes on his toes to steer it past point
fuller on off, punched back to mid-off
full outside off again, Williamson comes forward and drives, but straight to cover

caught at fine leg with some fancy footwork Short ball on the stumps, Williamson goes on the back foot to pull, but gets a top edge that swirls to fine leg. Sandakan is there and moves back to catch it, but the momentum is taking him over the rope. Throws the ball up in the air, steps over the boundary, comes back in and holds the ball. The kind of catch that is easily done nowadays, but still looks special when it comes off. Sri Lanka right on top now
bouncer first up, but well over the head and he can stay still and let it pass
good length, angling into him, and tucked to square leg
good length on the stumps, another slower ball. He waits for it and defends it back to the bowler
smart shot Malinga went for the wide yorker outside off, Munro gets low and cuts it late past the in-field and to the fence
angled into the batsman and defended to the leg side
tonked wide half-volley, and Munro launches it past cover. Didn't move his feet but was well balanced and timed it well, having spotted the slower ball early that time
better length, on the stumps and defended to mid-off
good length on leg stump, a slower one again. Clipped to square leg
too full on the pads, flicked well, but straight to midwicket
back of a length, jagging back in from outside off, Taylor inside edges it near his toes
fuller outside off, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
good length, on the sixth stump line, Taylor shoulders arms
fuller on off, he closes the bat face to clip it to mid-on's right and get off the mark
short ball angling into him, ends up on leg stump. Munro moves inside the line and pulls it to fine leg
floated up full outside off, and Munro threw his bat at it, and sends it to the third man boundary. Too much room outside off and gave Munro the chance to free his arms
gets it closer to off stump that time, and Munro takes a step forward to drive to mid-off
tossed up on leg stump, but Taylor goes down and paddles it fine. A bit of  fumble by the man giving chase at the fine leg fence, but while the ball doesn't cross the boundary, they get three runs
fuller on the stumps, he drives crisply to deep cover
quicker on leg stump, he tries to walk across and flick but gets a thickish leading edge that trickles back to the bowler
fuller on leg stump, comfortably turned to square leg
just outside off, good length, clipped back
too short and wide outside off, slashed to third man
fuller on leg stump, he was off balance but managed to jab it back to the bowler
good length angling across, punched to extra cover from off stump
good length on off, Taylor closes his bat face to tuck it to midwicket. The fielder runs in and has a shy, but the man backing up lets it through to give away a single
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid-off
clipped into the leg side

tossed up on leg stump, back of a length, he moves across and flicks to fine leg. The umpire signalled no-ball initially, thinking there was one fielder less inside the circle. But it's not a no-ball, and he takes the call back
drifting in and turns further, hitting him on the pads
leg-spinner, but too short and Munro stays beside the ball to cut it powerfully past point
comes down the track and pats it towards mid-on
went for the reverse sweep to one well outside off but doesn't connect
good length on off, but he takes a half-step forward to turn it to deep square leg
fullish length on leg stump. Blocked back
another full ball on leg, driven back past the bowler.
fuller ball patted back
fuller on the stumps, he moves across to work it to deep square leg

too full on off stump. Given Munro's guard, it actually lets him free his arms to crash this past extra cover. Fifty for him, and it's come at an important time, with Guptill and Williamson having fallen cheaply
very full on leg stump, clipped back
loses his line to go too far down leg and it's a wide
tossed up but very full again, and he comes on the front foot to clip it to midwicket
given a lot of air, and well outside off. He went hard at it but only got the toe end
flatter outside off, he lets it go. not much turn for Sandakan
down the track and he gets it through the in-field. waits for it and slices it past point
tossed up again, but very full, he comes forward and defends
length ball dipping in outside off, clipped to midwicket
length ball outside off again, he comes forward and blocks it back to the bowler
too short and Taylor pulls from outside off, but there is a sweeper on the leg side so he won't get a boundary
angled across and driven with a straight bat from outside off, but the timing wasn't quite there and mid-off fields
good length, cramping him for room too near the body. Tapped back
back of a length, tucking him up on leg stump again and he can only pat it into the leg side
floated up on leg stump, and worked to deep midwicket off the front foot
through him tossed up nicely and beats Munro's intended drive, pitching and turning just past the outside edge
tossed up again but too full, Munro takes a step down and flicks it on the full to deep midwicket
tossed up, too full on leg stump, Taylor nails the sweep, but not the placement, straight to square leg.
tosses it up again but too full, dipping on the batsman into a low full toss. He uses his wrists to flick to deep midwicket
on leg stump again, and turning away a bit, he works it to square leg
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
just wide of midwicket. Full ball in at middle stump. Looks to shovel it wide of mid-on and gets it off the toe-end
short of a length just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
length on middle stump, steps out and punches firmly back at the bowler, who stops to his right
full and into the pads. Stays inside the line of it despite how far down leg that is. Clips aerially and well square of fine leg
short of a length just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
full toss just outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch
lobbed up full and down leg side. Quick hands from Taylor as he stays low and swats this past short fine
full on off stump, driven to extra cover's right, can't beat him for the single at long-off
length on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
full outside off, jammed to extra cover's left
floated up at a length, dipping and drifting at an off stump line. Driven with the turn down to long-off. Wasn't to the pitch of that
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

dropped at long-on! Chandimal completely messes this up! A mis-hit from Munro, as he looks to pump a full ball straight over the bowler. Comes off the inside of the bat. Chandimal runs in, figures out he's overdone it, and as he looks to adjust, the wind brings the ball down quicker than he anticipates. In the end, he's just flailing to his right
drilled. This is tossed up full outside off and he gets to the pitch and launches it, flat, over the long-off boundary. Mid-off was in, so that's a safe option
length on the stumps, pushed into the leg side
top edge clears short fine. Full on leg stump, looks for the sweep and can't get on top of it
wrong'un, spinning into the pads from middle stump as he looks to flick
length, coming in at leg stump. Gets on the back foot and taps into the leg side

beats em all. Superb deception from the bowler, but no luck. Googly, floated up at a length outside off. Munro swipes at it without getting close and it's past the inside edge and through from between the keeper's legs
short of a length and turning in at off stump. Backs away and chops to point
full and wide down leg side. Plants the front leg out and looks to sweep. Inside edge is deflected off his pad, past short fine
full on off stump, tapped to extra cover's right
length outside off, tapped to sweeper cover on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
length at middle stump, on the back foot to punch to deep midwicket
not off the middle but comfortably clears long-on. Length on middle stump, steps out and gets this low and off the inside half
length on middle stump, blocked down the pitch
length on off stump, turning in at middle stump. Flicked to short fine's left
floated up at off stump, gets the front leg into the leg side and jabs it to long-off
tossed up at off stump, blocked down the pitch
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to backward point's left
length outside off, punched to extra cover's right
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
short and turning away outside off. Gets deep in the crease and chops to sweeper's left. Just comes back in for the second
short slider outside off, chops and misses
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
gorgeous. Taylors hits this so late so he can find the gap. Full outside off, gets the front foot out and bisects extra cover and sweeper with the drive
length at off stump, tapped down the pitch off the back foot
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
length ball slanting in at middle stump, defended into the off side
tossed up wide outside off, drilled to long-off's right
length outside off, dropped in front of point with soft hands
full outside off, driven to long-off's right
length at off stump, can't push this through cover on the up
too easy. Dropped short and wide and in the mid-80s. Skidding on nicely too. Taylor shapes up and cuts past backward point
one bounce and over the long-on boundary. Full on middle stump, clears the front leg and crashes this flat over the non-striker
length outside off, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point

oh that looks like the end for Munro! A terrible mix-up. Length ball dropped in front of point with soft hands. Munro has hared towards the other end but Taylor is ball watching and says no after a couple of steps down. Backward point swoops down on it and sends a throw on the bounce to Sandakan. It's wide, but the bowler lunges to his left to collect it and then flicks it onto the stumps. Third umpire replay shows Munro was well short. A terrible, terrible end for him. Looked in for a big score
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
googly at a length outside off. Pushes at it with hard hands and gets an inside edge into the leg side
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
length on off stump, blocked into the covers
length and slanting in at middle stump. Punched down the pttch
length outside off, punched to long-off on the up
length outside off, defended into the covers
googly, short of a length at leg stump. Whipped to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, looks to chop and gets a thick edge past short third
length on middle stump, defended towards the bowler
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
full on off stump, googly. Driven with the turn to long-off and that is yet another ODI fifty for Taylor. A modern-day colossus in this format
length on off stump, steps out and drives with the turn to long-off
short of a length outside off, punched to long-off from the crease
full on off stump, flicked to long-on
full on off stump, driven with the turn to sweeper cover
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, punched to extra cover
length ball skidding in at off stump. Backs away and drives through the point region with a flat bat
length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length, skidding in at middle stump. Defended off the thick inside edge
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
length outside off, beaten on the front foot as he looks to defend. That went straight on

run-out appeal at the non-striker's end. But Taylor has just managed to plonk the bat in. This full one was driven back at the bowler who parried it onto the stumps as he attempted to collect in his follow through
length on off stump, flicked with the turn to long-on
full on off stump, backs away and drives to extra cover's right
length ball wide outside off. Looks to drive, gets an under-edge through cover
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
length on off stump, gets forward and stabs through cover
length outside off, punched to long-off's left
length outside off, poked into the leg side
length on leg stump, gets down and sweeps. Gets a top edge that clears square leg
length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
full on off stump, gets low and sweeps straight to square leg
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right. His dive isn't enough to stop the single
length on middle stump, punched to long-on with the angle
full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
length outside off, nudged in front of short third with soft hands
length on middle stump, punched uppishly past the non-striker
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right with soft hands. Takes the fielder on for the second run and just makes it
short of a length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch
short of a length on off stump, on the back foot to punch to long-on
length on middle stump, steps out and pushes to long-on
full on off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
length on middle stump, swept to square leg's right and a bit of a fumble as he lunges for this
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Looks to slap on the up, gets an under-edge into the covers
length ball in at leg stump, punched to long-on with the angle
floated up at a length on middle stump. Stops on him as he shapes to flick. He pushes it back to the bowler
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
short of a length and wide outside off. Cut into the covers off the under-edge
length and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover off the front foot
immediately on target, yorker outside off that beats the batsman's airy drive
bouncer, but the batsman spotted it early and got nicely into position to pull it to deep square leg
draws the edge but it drops short of the keeper that swung through the air, away from the batsman. Kept a tad low too, and drew a poke from Taylor. The edge drops short of Dickwella
yorker on middle stump, clipped off his toes, and incredibly - it runs all the way to the midwicket fence. The placement was good and Nuwan Pradeep 's dive to stop the ball running from mid-on wasn't
very full again, a low full toss, turned to midwicket
he's getting the ball to swing, but this one is also a touch too full, ends up a low full toss and Taylor can flick it off his pads to deep square leg
floated up outside off, turning in a bit, he plays with the turn to work it to midwicket
great shot or smart shot more than great shot. Goes far across and gets down on one knee to sweep it from outside off to the fine leg fence, over the infield
shorter outside off, chops it down towards mid-off
length ball on the stumps, pushed back
nails the sweep again squarer and the ball travels further, though not over the rope. But the same shot as two balls back in other respects, going across, getting down and sweeping into the gap
quicker angled into the left-hander, he stays beside the ball and punches firmly to cover
good length around off stump, watchfully played back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump again, he dabs it into the offside close to him for a quick single

caught down the leg side short ball on leg stump, he moves inside the line to try and hook it, gets a thin edge that Dickwella gleefully accepts. Malinga had come on to break the partnership, and he's done just that. Not the best execution, but Malinga also got it to bounce more than expected, which perhaps is why Nicholls got an edge instead of middling it
back of a length on off stump, Neesham stands tall to punch it back
fuller length on off, watchfully defended back to the bowler
back of a length, moving away from the batsman again, Taylor pushes it to point
fuller on the stumps, worked to midwicket
good length, turning into Taylor from off and cramping him for room, he steers it towards point
tossed up outside off and turning further away, Neesham thick-edges it to the third man boundary. Intentional shot because there was no fielder there
fuller and driven to long-off
tossed up on leg stump, Taylor sweeps from a standing position almost, but short fine leg tumbles to his right to stop the ball
given air but too full, ends up as a full toss and driven past extra cover
drags it down short outside off, Neesham pulls off the front foot almost in front of square. Sweeper cleans up
short ball again, but not rising above waist, Taylor paddle-pulls it to fine leg
slower ball, and Neesham completely deceived. Turns into a dipping full toss outside off and Neesham's swing connects with air. If that had been straighter, could have sent him back bowled or lbw
bouncer, well directed, and Neesham ducks underneath
it does! slower ball that is again full and dipping, straighter that time. Neesham gets it away to fine leg off a thickish inside edge
another well directed bouncer, and Taylor was late on the pull, it in fact hits his helmet and goes to fine leg. Didn't even connect with the bat
good length around off, he plays it close to his body, tucking it to square leg
angling across him, he glides it from outside off to third man
shuffles across to clip this to fine leg
gorgeous timing angling well across the left-hander, and allows him to free his arms and hit a flowing cover drive that purrs across the outfield to the extra cover fence
brilliant from Neesham, length ball outside off and he opens the face of the bat to run it down to the third man fence
good length on the stumps, tucked to fine leg
it doesn't matter if Neesham is on strike or not. If Thisara's bowling at the death, the ball's going for six! too short and Taylor has been set for a while, swings it over cow corner

quicker bouncer that rose high over off stump. Taylor had made his mind up to attack, so he pulls it from outside off to midwicket, keeping it down. Was lazy in completing the single, a direct hit could have sent him back
bouncer, but totally misdirected. Way outside leg stump and given wide. Dickwella did well to leap up and collect
there he goes fuller ball on leg stump, and Neesham swings it high and over deep midwicket
better ball, short of a length and tucking him up, he clips it off his hips to fine leg
good length outside off, Taylor waits for it and cuts it to third man from close to the body
back of a length on leg stump, not giving him room to free his arms, which is the right idea. Neesham moves across to tuck it to deep square leg
tossed up, outside off, he comes on the front foot to get to the pitch of the ball and steer it past cover by opening the face of the bat
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-off
good length, in that uncertain neither forward-nor back spot. Neesham plays it from the crease, steering to silly point for a quick single
fuller on the stumps and out comes the lap-sweep. But there's short fine leg in place, so only a single
nicely tossed up and drifting into the left-hander, inside-edges it on to pad
good length, drawing him forward to drive. He does it without any real power, and can't go past cover
on target with a yorker on off stump, dug back out to the bowler
went for the yorker again, but didn't quite nail it this time, allowing Taylor to clip it to deep midwicket. Fifty-run partnership off just 35 balls
very full again, outside off, and Taylor drives it past extra cover. Some hard running gives them two again
full toss on middle stump, but Taylor misses out, clipping it straight to short midwicket
getting some swing, and goes for the yorker again. Marginally off length, and Taylor clips it to long-on
nails the yorker again, on middle and leg, Neesham digs it out towards short midwicket

he's run out going for the second! slower ball, swinging in to leg stump, he waits for it and turns it to fine leg. Taylor calls for the second, but he's not quick enough, and Kusal Perera fires in a superb throw, flat and right at the stumps. Dickwella completes the rest with Taylor clearly short of his crease. Not the best decision to go for that second run perhaps, but Taylor's done it all innings long. He's survived some close calls, but a good, hard, flat throw was always going to have him in trouble.
full toss on the pads, best ball to get off the mark, clipped to deep square leg easily enough
angled across and ends up well outside off. Neesham hits it sweetly, great timing, leaning into the cover drive. But there is a sweeper so only a single
back of a length on off, he tries to pull forcefully but only gets a bottom edge that rolls towards mid-on

slower ball beats him completely rolls his finger over it, and it came out at 108.7 kph. Seifert was just left feeling for it, into his push way too early. Fortunately for him, it went past the outside edge
too full, taken on the full and flicked to midwicket at the edge of the circle
slower ball again, ends up as a full toss on the pads. He waits for it and clips it to fine leg. Didn't pick it, but adjusted well enough
yorker on leg stump, but well played by Neesham, who shuffles slightly to pick it off his legs and flick it to deep square leg

leading edge falls safe another full ball on the pads, ends up as a low full toss. Moving in the air a bit though, and Neesham closes the face too early. The leading edge flies over midwicket and lands safe

appeal for lbw and Malinga is reviewing it One of the old Malinga specials, swinging into the left hander, staying low and hitting the pads. However, this one pitched outside leg, so Neesham stays. Sri Lanka lose their review
full ball on middle, he drives it gently to long-off
full toss outside off, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
too full and Neesham uses his power to swing at it hard, and sends it along the ground to fine leg
in the blockhole, and defended into the off side. With all the fielders back, they take the quick single
slower ball again, good length outside off. He has to wait for it and pushes it to the bowler's left to take another quick single
another slower ball, and Neesham pulls hard to midwicket but didn't pick the slower one, so no timing on that.
a quick bouncer outside off after a succession of slower ones, and the batsman takes him on. Goes aerial but it is one-bounce to deep midwicket
very full on the stumps, and flicked to deep square leg
short on leg stump, but the ball doesn't rise too high. Neesham swivels and pulls it from just above his waist and sends the ball screaming to square leg
good ball, yorker on leg stump, turned away to fine leg
down the track, and outside off, but in giving himself room he has to stretch out to connect and sends the ball to long-on off the toe-end
Neesham's taking off doesn't nail the yorker and Neesham gets under it to lift it straight back. Long-on is interested for a bit, but the ball beats his jump. Fifty for Neesham too
bouncer, but well down leg side and is a wide
deja vu for Thisara in the slot once again and Neesham swings his arms blithely to deposit this way over midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, swiped into the leg side to deep square's left

direct hit! Another run out for New Zealand. And it's Neesham this time. Digs out a yorker pitch side on the off side, it bounces up nicely for the bowler who picks up one-handed and swivels to demolish the stumps at the non-striker's end. Didn't appear at first like Neesham wanted that run and the hesitation costs them. Seifert had nearly completed the run
nicely bowled. Slower bouncer outside off. Through the pull too early and he misses
yorker at the stumps, leans in and clips to deep midwicket
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Punched to sweeper cover
superb, just superb from Pradeep. Another slower ball, 105kph. At a length outside off. Southee sets up for the slap over cover but he's completely deceived. This slides under the bat
Nicely done. Slower ball, full outside off. Jumps into the off side early to set up for the ramp. Waits on it, adjusts, and goes through with the shot to clear short fine
oh dear, just stop the nightmare. Perera doesn't know where to bowl now. Overpitched on off stump. Gets the front leg out of the way and drags this over the wide long-on boundary
short of a length on middle stump, paddled towards fine leg
full outside off, gets into the leg side and drills it on the bounce to long-on

full and just outside off, drilled to sweeper's right. Run-out chance misses at the non-striker's end. The throw is wide for Perera, but that's probably because he's to the right of the stumps, rather than behind them
run-out number four. Yorker at off stump, jammed back at the bowler who picks up calmly, runs back and clips the bails at the non-striker's
full outswinger at off stump, closes the face and punches to mid-on
length outside off, tapped into the covers with soft hands
length ball curving away outside off. Poked into the covers off the back foot
length outside off, defended off the back foot to point's left
short of a length outswinger, wide outside off. Swishes at it and gets a thick edge down to third man
falls short of mid-on! Henry diving forward but can't get that. Length ball straightens on him from middle stump as he looks to flick. Also stops on him a touch as he pokes well in front of the body
length ball shaping in outside off, but a lot of room and Gunathilaka uses that to slap a delightful drive to mid-off's right
length ball swung down leg side
full inswinger outside off, driven to mid-off's left
length on off stump, blocked into the off side
length ball swung into the pads, flicked to fine leg's right
length on leg stump, clipped to fine leg

whipped to the midwicket boundary. He loves this pick-up over the leg side. Length at middle stump Southee and Dickwella doesn't even need to get to the pitch. Just hits across the line comfortably, on the up
good length, outswinger outside off. Steps out and swipes to be beaten
outswinger, outside off from a good length. Left alone
boom! What a connection! Short ball rising up in the corridor and he jumps above it to pummel this pull in front of square
full and down leg side, can't come close to making connection on this
length on leg stump, tapped to square leg on the up
length ball shaping away in the corridor. Defends inside the line and gets a thick edge to third man
short of a length, curving away from off stump. Slips in the crease and is squared up as he defends off the back foot
full and wide down leg, past the attempted flick
short ball just outside off, pulled to deep square's right
inswinging full toss at middle stump has him cramped. He digs it into the pitch and looks at the leg umpire. Not a no-ball he says. Rightly so, that was thigh height
length outside off, gently nudged to mid-off's right
short ball pushed across off stump. Toe-ended pull to deep square's right
low full toss at middle stump, clipped to deep square's right

chops it on! Slower ball has done him. It's short of a length, shaping away from off stump. It's there for the late cut - the single at third man. But it's slower than usual and Dickwella's angled bat is hazardous as a result. Into off and middle stump off the inside edge
outswinger in the corridor at a length. Nicely timed stab with an open face, rockets to cover point on the bounce
length outside off, tapped into the off side
length at middle stump, into the pads off the inside edge as he pushes at this
outswinger at off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball shaping away from off stump. Defended into the covers
length and just outside off. Jammed into the turf off the toe-end
length on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length and cutting away from the channel. Punched on the up to point
length outside off, hangs the bat out and punches on the up. Can't beat point to his left
length and in at the stumps. Watchfully pushed back at the bowler
length at leg stump, looks to tickle it fine, cops it on the thigh guard
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full on leg stump, clipped straight to square leg
short and wide outside off, toe-ended cut to third man's left. Sodhi with an awkward, tumbling pick up there, but an effective one nonetheless
length at the pads, flicked aerially to fine leg
shot. Tremendous bat-speed. This guy has some ability. Length ball outside off, steps out and holds his shape as he makes room and brings out a straight bat to punch this flat over mid-off
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and taps to backward point
short and in the corridor. Dabbed to third man's right. Sodhi more assured as he slides to get behind the ball this time
length ball pushed across off, swipes at it and gets an inside edge back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, can't beat backward point with the cut. Outstretched right hand from Guptill
length ball skidding low and past the inside edge outside off. Looking to bludgeon that through cover
sweet. Full and just outside off, brings the bat down nicely and offers the full face. Lifts it at the last moment to get it between umpire and non-striker
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
length at leg stump, deflected to fine leg off the thigh guard as he looks to flick
length ball shaping away from off. Defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, deflected to fine leg off the thigh guard
short of a length at leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the back foot
slower ball drifts from a length and past his outside edge as he looks to poke this to third man
short and wide outside off, left alone
shot. Short of a length and just outside off. Gets behind the line and punches it between backward point and cover point
short and wide outside off. Goes too hard with the cut. Gets it to mid-off via the toe-end
attempted slower yorker. Met on the full outside off and punched back at the bowler
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
slower ball at a length outside off. Jabbed down the pitch off the back foot
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Jabbed to extra cover off the back foot
length on off stump, behind the line but punched straight back to the bowler
dropped! Williamson, nearly! Short and wide and filthy. Gunathilaka slashes it straight at Nicholls who tumbles and grasses it at point
length on off stump, blocked into the front foot
length outside off, tapped into the covers
length outside off, pushed to extra cover's right with soft hands
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a length, ripping and climbing outside off as he looks to cut. Can't get bat on that. Or did he? It's a dropped catch from Seifert if he did. We'll see...
full and wide outside off, drilled handsomely to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right
bouncer outside off, hooked along the turf to deep square
length outside off, punched to extra cover's right
bouncer dug in too short. Left alone
full on the pads. Can't get bat as he looks to flick
full at middle stump, nicely driven with a straight bat, but he can't beat the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length outside off, punched to extra cover
short of a length outside off, sliced to sweeper cover
length outside off, defended to extra cover

great effort by Neesham at sweeper, but that was too much to do to his right. Short of a length ball, cut late this time. He sprinted to his right, put in the slide and got to it. Tried to prevent it from sliding away from him by getting his left hand on it, but he touched the rope with his back as he did so
length outside off, cut to sweeper
length ball just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man

taken at third man! It was coming, wasn't it? Henry has kept it very quiet, tying Kusal up. Making him struggle with the short stuff and no room. Now he slants a short one across the corridor. Kusal wants to pull and gets a top edge that gets Boult to run in a little at third man to pouch that
short of a length at middle stump. Gets on top of the bounce and tickles it behind square on the leg side
full at middle stump. Flicked to midwicket's right
length at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, solidly behind this to defend
length at off stump, on the back foot to flick through midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
short ofa length and slanted across the corridor. Stays leg side of it and opens the face late to get it to short third man's right
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
length and turning in just outside off. Jabbed to extra cover's right off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, opens the face and chops to third man. That's fifty for him and he's looked near-perfect, except when playing the cut against part-timers...
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full and into the pads. Flicked to deep square, uppishly

Mendis would've been gone with the direct hit. Length ball dropped pitch side on the off side. They want to punch the single but Nicholls is quick on the ball from extra cover. Can't hit the stumps at the striker's end
length on middle stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot

nice and safe. Straight over the bowler. Length ball at off stump. Half a stride and a clean swing as he lifted this. Off the high part of the bat, not the greatest timing, but mid-off and mid-on are both in
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on middle, flicked to midwicket
full on middle stump, blocked down the pitch
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on's right

stunning. Someone must investigate why this guy averages only 27. Short of a length and rising up at him outside off. He springs up to get beside the bounce and opens the face at the perfect moment to get this racing into the boundary to third man's right. High elbow and all
short ball at the stumps, left alone
length on middle stump, tucked to mid-on off the front foot
short of a length just outside off. Drops it into the pitch with soft hands to steal the single. Guptill sprints in and has a shy at the stumps. Gives them an overthrow at deep square
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man with the angle
short and up at the chest. Gets on top of the bounce and rolls his wrists to get this hook down to fine leg
shorter length, he moves across to tuck it to the leg side
reverse sweep for four
fuller on leg stump, driven down the ground
tossed up on a nice length that forces him to take a big stride out to defend this on off stump
flatter and skids on, he goes deep in his crease to flick this to midwicket
googly, too short and he rocks back to pull, but doesn't get hold of it cleanly. Short fine leg collects
starts with one that moves in a bit from the stumps to end up on the pads, and is flicked to fine leg
goes around the wicket, ends up as a high full toss outside off, punched to the cover fence where sweeper runs around to clean up

big appeal for caught behind by the keeper... but it's given wide. Pitches on middle and continues with the angle, the batsman misses the tickle. Didn't seem to get anything on it and it's down legside, so wide
too short, too wide outside off and crashed through point for four
better length outside off, he dabs it in front and wants to take a single. Loud call of 'NO' by Mendis sends him back. Wisely enough because point was swooping in and had a shy at the stumps
too wide outside off again, and he throws his bat at it, carves it over point. Southee at third man covers good ground to slide and stop the ball from going into the fence
gets it straighter and the batsman is happy to defend, showing the full face of the bat
tossed up, drifting in a tad on off, and defended off the front foot
nice length by Sodhi, forcing him to take a big stride out to meet the ball. On off again
gets it too full that time, and is clipped off the batsman's toes to midwicket
drags it a little shorter, but Mendis doesn't connect with the pull well, it rolls to short midwicket
tossed up outside off and he comes forward to defend
just over short midwicket too short, and his eyes must have lit up, but he doesn't connect with the pull again, with the ball skidding on a bit. Got enough on it to just clear Williamson at midwicket
opens the face to glide it to third man
well outside off and in driving range, so he square drives it past the in-field
good length around off, he crouches low to jab it into the off side
good length outside off again, and he waits for it to come on, then steers it towards third man again
too full and enough width outside off to get the cover drive flowing, but he has protection in the deep with a sweeper
full outside off and driven to the man at deep point by opening the face of the bat

oh Mendis will be filthy with himself this was drifting down leg, a bit short, and turned a bit. Mendis moved inside the line to paddle-sweep it, but only managed to pop it to Seifert off his bottom edge. The New Zealanders are gleeful, and why not. They've broken yet another partnership before it could go from promising to threatening
tossed up and a touch too full, but Chandimal is new to the crease so he defends carefully
given some air again, on middle stumps, blocked to midwicket
gets some drift again, and beats his sweep. Was the googly, so turned the other way, flicked pad and went to fine leg. Sodhi appealed for an lbw, but that was probably missing leg
goes back to cut it towards point
full ball on middle, and driven back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, and nudged to short third man
pitches on middle and moving into the batsman, flicked off his pads to midwicket
good length outside off, he checks his drive, as the ball bounces to cover

high up in the air and taken by the keeper near backward point Down the track came Gunathilaka and had an almighty swipe at it, only got it off the end of the bat and sent it steepling behind him. Seifert called for it early and settled under it nicely. Neesham continues to be an insurmountable obstacle for Sri Lanka - with bat or ball
length ball, coming in slightly from middle stump, he goes back and flicks it to deep square leg
loses his line to go down leg side. Not very far from leg stump but those are all called 'wide' in limited-overs cricket
back of a length outside off, he comes close to the ball and steers it to backward point

loud shout for lbw and that seemed mighty close. Didn't pick the googly at all. and it spins past his forward prod to hit him on the pads. Not given. And we can see why on the replay, the thinnest of edges there
outside off but swept hard and with good timing to deep square leg
that is a wide down leg but not a bad ball at all. Tossed up and dipping on the batsman, who is drawn outside his crease and disbalanced. Googly. Seifert collects it down leg
stays in his crease to punch this to long-on
that one skidded on quicker and he had to bring his bat down hurriedly to jab it away
another wrong 'un, pushed towards cover

he's not been reading the googly and it's done him in. A little short, Chandimal cleared his front leg, probably intending to crash it through the off side, but it spins back in, under flailing bat, and hits the stumps. Sri Lanka's hole gets deeper
fullish length outside off, he comes forward and drives to cover
top edge goes to fine leg for a boundary digs this in short, and he moved inside the line to pull it. Got a top edge, but had the placement right, with no fielder at fine leg
too straight, angling into the stumps from wide of the crease, and turned to fine leg
gets the bouncer right that time, in line with the batsman, who ducks under it
angled across him, drives it from off stump towards mid-off
short ball, angling away and ends up outside off, he rises on his toes to slash it from close to his body over point. No fielder at deep point so it was a safe shot
tried to work it away from leg stump, but couldn't connect well enough
gets his line slightly off, and bowls this down leg. Wide

that's a suicidal run and another one falls Neesham the fielder at short third man, who else can it be? Nice bowling by Sodhi, tossed up on a perfect length and dipping. Breaks after pitching on leg, and Thisara tries to turn it fine. Looks up to see Gunaratne charging down and responds, but Neesham picks up and throws it to Seifert in one swift motion, catching him well short
tossed up nicely again, he takes a tentative step forward and a tentative jab to mid-on
tossed up again, and defended more solidly outside off
another one on a good length on off, and he comes forward to defend to point

Sodhi's on fire wild slog from Seekkuge, who didn't read the wrong un. Stood in his crease and tried to lift this over the infield. Gets an inside edge that crashes into the stumps. This is ending quickly
short outside off, he cuts it uppishly over point. They run two, but Malinga was very casual in getting back. Direct hit would have had him
attempted yorker results in a low full toss, and Thisara gets a measure of revenge, flicking it to deep midwicket off Neesham

back of a length, moving across thisara, who tucks it into the leg side. There is a run there, but Malinga seems disinterested. Goes through but doesn't even ground his bat, and doesn't seem to want to hurry into the crease either!
bouncer, well directed, and Malinga ducks under it
slower ball, leg-cutter outside off. Comprehensively beats the batsman. Malinga plays away from the body with legs rooted, misses the intended push altogether
lovely flight and dip again, Thisara comes forward to defend, the ball rolls to the bowler off the outside edge
given some air on leg stump again, he wants to give himself room but ends up defending close to his body
drags it a mite short and Thisara does his 'stand and deliver' thingy. Googly spinning away so he frees his arms and crashes it past extra cover
tossed up on leg stump again, and he comes on the front foot to defend, using pads as second line of defence
leg-break pitches on middle on a good length and spinning back into Thisara, who cuts from close to his body but straight to cover
tossed up on leg stump but too full, and he's able to turn it away to fine leg
nicely picked up from his legs to the deep midwicket boundary. A touch too full on leg stump and Thisara latches on
the bowler corrects his line to go outside off, and Thisara says, 'I can hit you there too'. Comes on the front foot to drive over mid-off and into the long-off fence
good length on the stumps, he shuffles and clips to midwicket
edged, but falls short of the keeper. wide outside off, Malinga's feet never moved, but he tried to slash it well away from body. Gets the edge
bouncer, but going well over so Malinga can duck under it easily
another bouncer, better directed them, but Malinga still ducks under it
googly again, a touch too full, he stays in his crease and punches it past cover
good length outside off and spinning away. Malinga comes forward but lets it go through
tossed up and gets some drift so it ends up on middle stump. Malinga unfurls a picture perfect sweep, connects cleanly and sends it to the square leg boundary

big appeal for lbw and they've gone for the review after it was given not out. another googly, that pitches on the perfect length, draws him forward and spins past the defensive prod of the bat to hit pad. No bat involved says Snicko, so this might be very tight for Malinga. Hit him in front of middle I reckon, so it might be going down. And wait - what';s this - there is no ball tracking available! so the decision stays. That's quite incredible. New Zealand won't lose a review, because the system failed.
too short and too wide outside off, Malinga nails the cut past point. Fielders sprinting after it pull it back in before it hits the ropes
ooh that leg break turned. Malinga was stuck on the back foot and his bat hung limply out, takes the edge and goes past slip
outside off, pushed to cover.
smashed too short and he stays still, swivels and connects hard and clean, sending it flat over square leg
low full toss, driven powerfully, but straight to cover
and that's flat-batted over mid-off for four. Stand and deliver again from Thisara. Too short, too wide, and a misdirected slower ball that's had the cover smashed off it
fuller ball on the stumps, driven to deep extra cover
back of a length, gets it to bounce from outside off and into the rib cage, Malinga keeps it out
Thisara has taken plenty of punishment, he's dishing it out now. Down the track and hits the full ball straight and true back over the bowler's head
he was waiting for the over-compensated short ball, rocks on the back foot and pulls powerfully over the midwicket boundary
down the track again, but not timed as well, hits it over the bowler for a couple
wrong un', and he stays in his crease, and clears his leg to crash it to the extra cover fence from off stump. Fifty for Thisara
quicker and flatter on the stumps, jabbed into the off side
doesn't get hold of this and it swirls high in the air but lands safely over extra cover
angling into him from around the wicket, and Malinga just stays in his crease and pokes at it. Inside edges it onto pad
angled in again, Malinga was backing away but the ball follows him. Defends it back to the bowler
backs away again, but this time Boult keeps it outside off. Malinga connects with the slap, and they jog through for a single to get Thisara back on strike
full ball, almost in the block hole, driven to long-off

dropped by Colin Munro at deep square leg well directed bouncer, Malinga was trying to get out of the way while swatting it. Sends it in the air to square leg. Munro is running in and gets to the ball comfortably, but incredibly enough - spills it. New Zealand have just gone slightly ragged since that DRS failure, with Thisara taking charge post that.
doesnt connect with the drive
bouncer at off stump. Backs away and swings at it to be beaten
full and in at middle stump. Backs away and pushes it down the pitch
clears midwicket. Short ball cramping him at the waist. Backs away and slices it over that fielder
full and just outside off. Backs away and chops to extra cover

dropped! Boult running to his right from mid-off can't hang on as he slides in the mid-on area. He got there and will be disappointed he didn't take it. Length ball at middle stump, backs away and swings at it. Top edge, doesn't go too high. Just enough for Boult to have time
oh well played. Slower short ball at middle stump. Backs away, waits on it and lofts it over cover. There's no one deep on the square boundaries in the off side
over the keeper. This partnership is 75! In 8.1 overs. Short ball at middle stump, walking into the leg side as he swings at this. Top edge gets him four
off the pad and into middle stump. Boult won't even celebrate that. Slower ball at a good length, follows Malinga down leg side. He looks to flick and is beaten on the inside edge
short of a length at middle stump. Defended down the pitch off the back foot
short of a length just outside off. Defended to point off the outside half
short and wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
full at middle stump, backs away and punches aerially to long-off. Doesn't take the run
length ball outside off, punched firmly on the up to long-off's right. That's hit hard and Southee takes some time to stabilize after fielding that to his right
length at off stump, pushed to long-off off the back foot
yorker at off stump. Jammed down the pitch
bouncer in the corridor, left alone
clears Seifert. Short one at the chest. Cramped on the hook and he gets a glove on it that lobs over the keeper who is leaping one-handed
full at off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and drills it to long-off's left
past the outside edge. Short and climbing in the corridor. Hangs the bat out and misses
full on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's right
clears long-on! Misses the yorker. It's overpitched on middle. Backs away and allows it to land at middle stump to drill it flat
short of a length at middle stump. Pulls to deep midwicket
bouncer at off stump, arches backwards and lets it go
past off stump. Length ball slanted across middle stump. Looks to lift this over extra cover and is beaten
short, leg stump line. Ducks under it to let it go
yorker at leg stump. Looks to drive straight and gets it off the inside edge. Trickles into the midwicket region and the two deep fielders can't get there quick enough to save the second
deft! Smart batting from Perera. Knows the length that's coming and he's stayed leg side to get this over short third man. Short one at middle and a late ramp
full at leg stump, flicked between long-on and deep midwicket
length at middle stump, mistimed loft towards long-on. Just what he needs for the single to keep strike
inswinging yorker at off stump. Can't do more than push that down the pitch

dropped! Williamson at long-off lets it through and it's six! Highest score for Perera too. That was the match for New Zealand. Full ball at off stump, drills it off the low part of the bat so there isn't elevation on this. Williamson gets under it and times his jump well too at head height. But can't get his fingers behind it
yorker at off stump, digs it into the pitch. Lovely bowling
over long-on! By some way! Length from Boult, in at middle stump. Makes room and swings cleanly to clear the boundary with some ease
bouncer just outside off, ducks under it
full on off stump, taps it back towards the bowler and screams in anger. A drive and that was an easy single at long-off
inside edge to fine leg! Slower ball just outside off, back of a length. Looks to punch and gets it past leg stump
full outside off, driven into the covers
yorker at middle stump, jammed back to the bowler
full outside off, throws his arms at this, gets it to long-off off the toe-end
length ball at off stump, gets behind the line and defends solidly on the back foot to much applause from the away section
short and wide outside off, swats at it and sports a sheepish smile. Didn't need to chase that and he knows it

no he will not look to play him out! Misses on the yorker again, does Boult. It's overpitched and it's wide enough outside off to give him plenty of room. He swings cleanly under it and Williamson watches it sail over him at long-off
bouncer is dug in too short and he lets it go
full and in at middle stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
oh dear. Slower ball pushed way down leg side
short of a length outside off, opens the face and stabs to third man

maiden ODI hundred for Perera! What an innings. What a time to get it and how he needed this. He's been plundered at the slog overs, two games in a row, but Thisara will breathe easy for some time. Helmet off, all his team-mates on their feet. This was a full ball on leg stump and he flicked it to deep square
length at off stump, defended into the off side
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
falls short of midwicket. Length at leg stump, one hand comes off as he slogs at this
wide of gully. Taylor leaping to his right, one-handed. Oh he's got a finger on it. But that was difficult. Short outside off and he cut hard at that
slower short ball at middle stump, waits on it and pulls to deep midwicket's left
past the outside edge. Length ball in the corridor, defends inside the line
short ball at off stump, ducks under it

taken by Taylor! Neesham produces the magic once again. What a comeback he's had. Short ball lifts up steeply from off stump. Too good for Sandakan. He's looking to defend and it pings up into the third slip region. Taylor lunges forward and holds on
full and wide yorker. Dips inwards from the wide marker as Perera leaves
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
full and wide again! Swings at it but that's well wide of him
yorker length wide outside off, chops at it and can't get bat on it

dropped! Guptill runs in from long-off and puts down a simple one. Looks like he's damaged his finger too. Runs off immediately. Or is he just embarrassed? Low full toss dipping away outside off. Swings across the line, get s a top edge. Ground made, catch dropped. Same old story.
bouncer at off stump, sways into the leg side to let it go
yorker at leg stump, defends down the pitch
full and in at off stump. Pushed back to the bowler
slower ball just outside off, backs away and looks to club it. Beaten on the outside edge
pow! He's short-arm slogged a slower short ball over midwicket! Imagine the power. Leg stump line, plenty of time to pick the slower ball and he swats him off the front foot
clears the extra cover boundary! Full and wide outside off. Stays still and reaches out with his hands. Opens the face late and sends it 76 metres
inside edge onto front pad. Short ball at middle stump, looks to pull and can't get it away
short ball alright, and a mistimed pull. Once again, exactly what he needed. It drops into the circle at mid-on and they cross over
bouncer at an off stump line, keeps the bat withdrawn and jumps away to let it go

suh-weeet! That sound! Wow. A low full toss outside off and it cannot be middled better than that. Doesn't even need to swing - just a check-punch. It's far, far over the wide long-on boundary. 96 metres! It's rolled off somewhere too after landing in the grassbanks. We're getting a replacement ball

mistimed but another six! Shuffles early this time, gets a high full toss this time. It's wide and he slices from underneath. The wind carries it. Long-on and long-off converge...and watch it clear the boundary
beaten. Slower ball at a length outside off, walks across and swings at it but that skids under
another full toss! Another six! How the tables have turned! New Zealand have no clue where to bowl to him. Outside off, in his zone and he slots it over long-on again!
now way! Southee has lost his length completely. Another full toss. Just outside off. A half-step into into the off side and a launch over square leg this time. Unreal stuff.
well bowled. Thisara shuffles and Southee sends a bouncer across the channel, straight at his helmet. Ducks under it

they'll get three! The point fielder tracks back as this trickles towards the boundary and pulls it back in. Pradeep and Sri Lanka will be grateful for that. Munro there. Full and in at off stump. Backs away and slices a gorgeous drive to beat the diving cover fielder to his left
bouncer. Wide! Henry not happy with that. A sharp bouncer. Perera backed away and it was too fast for him. Replays show it was the right call

Boult leaps forward and ends the pain at long-on! What a catch! Not quite, for Thisara Perera. It was in the slot, length ball on leg stump. Short-arm jab again but this time it's off the toe-end. It dips on Boult who sprints some ten yards and pulls off a stunner. After five dropped catches, it took some compensation
